title: 1980’s subtitle font (Serif–Slab Serif)
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724113242im_/http:/typophile.com/files/subtitles_font_4922.jpg)

Do you know what font this is? It was used for subtitles in the 80’s.

Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1980s\_subtitles font\_closeup.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724113242/http:/typophile.com/files/1980s_subtitles%20font_closeup.jpg) | 25.01 KB |
author: Type-M

comments.content:
Looks like [Memphis](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724113242/http:/www.identifont.com/show?RJ), but the A is missing the top serifs of Memphis.  
Don

Thanks for your input.

Yes, it’s similar to Memphis but seems to have more rounded serifs (might be the low resolution) and is not as geometric in it’s shapes. The letters ”g” and ”t” differs from Memphis as well.

Does anyone know what font this might be?
